citation.article-title: Roseicitreum antarcticum gen. nov., sp. nov., an aerobic bacteriochlorophyll a-containing alphaproteobacterium isolated from Antarctic sandy intertidal sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Roseicitreum (Ro.se.i.ci′tre.um. L. adj. roseus rose-coloured; L. neut. n. citreum citron, lemon; N.L. neut. n. Roseicitreum pink lemon).
Gram-negative, obligately heterotrophic, strictly aerobic, non-motile and moderately halophilic.
Cells contain bchl a and poly-β-hydroxybutyrate.
Does not grow photoautotrophically with H2/CO2 (80 : 20, v/v) or photo-organotrophically with acetate or glutamate anaerobically.
Positive for cytochrome oxidase and catalase.
The predominant cellular fatty acid is C18 : 1ω7c.
The polar lipids phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylcholine are present.
The type species of the genus is Roseicitreum antarcticum.
